questions.questionText: For each ADL listed below, code the resident's USUAL performance during your shift using the Coding Legend provided below. Activities may be completed with or without assistive devices. May obtain data by resident observation or resident interview.
If the activity did not occur on your shift, code the appropriate reason.
= Activity Did Not Occur
= Independent
= Needs Staff Assist of 2
= Not attempted due to medical condition/safety concerns
= Set Up or Clean Up Help ONLY
=Extensive Assist with LESS than 1/2 of ADL completion
=Extensive Assist with MORE than 1/2 of ADL completion
=Limited Assist OR Supervision
=Not Applicable. Did not perform this ADL prior to hospital stay
=Not attempted due to environmental limitations (weather, lack of equipment)
=Resident Refused
=Totally Dependent

questions.questionTitle: Eating: The ability to use suitable utensils to bring food and/or liquid to mouth and swallow food/liquid once the meal is placed before the resident

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive assist with more than 1/2 of ADL
Extensive assist with less than 1/2 of ADL

questions.questionTitle: Oral Hygiene: The ability to use suitable items to clean teeth. Dentures (if applicable): The ability to insert and remove dentures to/from the mouth and manage equipment for soaking and rinsing them

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive assist with more than 1/2 of ADL
Exetensive assist with less than 1/2 ADL

questions.questionTitle: Toileting Hygiene: The ability to maintain perineal hygiene, adjust clothes before and after voiding or having a bowel movement. If managing an ostomy, include wiping the opening but not managing the equipment

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive assist with more than 1/2 of ADL
Extensive assist with less than 1/2 of ADL

questions.questionTitle: Shower/Bathe Self: The ability to bathe self, including washing, rinsing, and drying self (excludes washing of the back or hair). Does NOT include transfers in/out of tub/shower chair

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive assist with more than 1/2 of ADL
Extensive assist with less than 1/2 of ADL

questions.questionTitle: Upper Body Dressing: The ability to dress and undress ABOVE the waist; including fasteners, if applicable

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive Assist for more than 1/2 of ADL
Extensive Assist for less than 1/2 of ADL

questions.questionTitle: Lower Body Dressing: The ability to dress and undress BELOW the waist; including fasteners, if applicable

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive Assist for more than 1/2 of ADL
Extensive Assist for less than 1/2 of ADL

questions.questionTitle: Putting On/Taking Off Footwear: The ability to put on and take off socks and shoes or other footwear that is appropriate for safe mobility; including fasteners, if applicable

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive Assist for more than 1/2 of ADL
Extensive Assist for less than 1/2 of ADL

assessmentQuestionGroups.groupText: Resident completes the activity with no assistance from a helper.

questions.questionText: For each ADL listed below, code the resident's USUAL performance during your shift using the Coding Legend provided below. Activities may be completed with or without assistive devices. May obtain data through resident observation or resident interview.
<b>If the activity did not occur on your shift, code the appropriate reason.
= Activity Did Not Occur
= Extensive Assist with LESS than 1/2 of ADL Completion
= Extensive Assist with MORE than 1/2 of ADL completion
= Independent
= Limited Assist OR Supervision
= Needs Staff Assist of 2
= Not Appliacble. Did not perform this ADL prior to hospital stay
= Not attempted due to environmental limitations (weather, lack of equipment)
= Not attempted due to medical condition/ safety concerns
= Resident Refused
= Set Up or Clean Up Help ONLY
= Totally Dependent

questions.questionTitle: Roll Left and Right: The ability to roll from lying on back to left and right side, and return to lying on their back on the bed

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive Assist for more than 1/2 of ADL
Extensive Assist with less than 1/2 ADL

questions.questionTitle: Sit to Lying: The ability to move from sitting on the side of the bed to lying flat on the bed

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive Assist for more than 1/2 of ADL
Extensive Assist with less than 1/2 ADL

questions.questionTitle: Lying to Sitting on the Side of the Bed: The ability to move from lying on the back to sitting on the side of the bed with feet flat on the floor, and with no back support

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive Assist for more than 1/2 of ADL
Extensive Assist with less than 1/2 ADL

questions.questionTitle: Sit to Stand: The ability to come to a standing position from sitting in a chair, wheelchair, or on the side of the bed

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive Assist for more than 1/2 of ADL
Extensive Assist with less than 1/2 ADL

questions.questionTitle: Chair/Bed-to-Chair Transfer: The ability to transfer to and from a bed to a chair (or wheelchair

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive Assist for more than 1/2 of ADL
Extensive Assist with less than 1/2 ADL

questions.questionTitle: Toilet Transfer: The ability to get on and off a toilet or commode

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive Assist for more than 1/2 of ADL
Extensive Assist with less than 1/2 ADL

questions.questionTitle: Car Transfer: The ability to transfer in and out of a car or van on the passenger side. Does not include the ability to open/close the door or fasten seat belt

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive Assist for more than 1/2 of ADL
Extensive Assist with less than 1/2 ADL

questions.questionTitle: Walk 10 Feet: Once standing, the ability to walk at least 10 feet in a room, corridor, or similar space.

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive Assist for more than 1/2 of ADL
Extensive Assist with less than 1/2 ADL

questions.questionTitle: Walk 50 Feet with Two Turns: Once standing, the ability to walk at least 50 feet and make two turns

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive Assist for more than 1/2 of ADL
Extensive Assist with less than 1/2 ADL

questions.questionTitle: Walk 150 Feet: Once standing, the ability to walk at least 150 feet in a corridor or similar space

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive Assist for more than 1/2 of ADL
Extensive Assist with less than 1/2 ADL

questions.questionTitle: Walking 10 Feet on an Uneven Surface: The ability to walk 10 feet on an uneven or sloping surface (indoor or outdoor) such as turf or gravel

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive Assist for more than 1/2 of ADL
Extensive Assist with less than 1/2 ADL

questions.questionTitle: 1 Step (Curb): The ability to go up and down a curb and/or up and down 1 step

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive Assist for more than 1/2 of ADL
Extensive Assist with less than 1/2 ADL

questions.questionTitle: 4 Steps: The ability to go up and down 4 steps with or without a rail

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive Assist for more than 1/2 of ADL
Extensive Assist with less than 1/2 ADL

questions.questionTitle: 12 Steps: The ability to go up and down 12 steps with or without a rail

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive Assist for more than 1/2 of ADL
Extensive Assist with less than 1/2 ADL

questions.questionTitle: Picking Up an Object: The ability to bend/stoop from a standing position to pick up a small object, such as a spoon, from the floor

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive Assist for more than 1/2 of ADL
Extensive Assist with less than 1/2 ADL

questions.questionTitle: Wheeling 50 Feet with Two Turns: Once seated in wheelchair/scooter, the ability to wheel at least 50 feet and make two turns

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive Assist for more than 1/2 of ADL
Extensive Assist for less than 1/2 of ADL

questions.questionTitle: Wheeling 150 Feet: Once seated in wheelchair/scooter, the ability to wheel at least 150 feet in a corridor or similar space

responseOptions.responseText: Extensive Assist for more than 1/2 of ADL
Extensive Assist for less than 1/2 of ADL
